Discussions.Discussion_Name: Reminder: Guest Lecture tomorrow on India

Messages.Author: Megha Tyagi
Messages.Content: Dear students,  This is a reminder for tomorrow's guest lecture on India. It will be presented by two co-founders of the firm Beyond Urban, ANIRUDH BADARINATH and ANUJA KOTHAWALA. Here are the links to their LinkedIn profiles: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anirudh-b-29a880ba/ and https://www.linkedin.com/in/anuja-kothawala-69566a91/.  About Beyond Urban (https://beyond-urban.com/) It is young partnership on a mission to understand India’s cities and city regions. Beyond Urban started as a venture in April 2022 with a conscious intent to contribute towards plan and policymaking rooted in evidence. The organization take pride in their ability to work with teams, often cutting across disciplinary boundaries. At Beyond Urban, the broad area interests and strengths is transportation planning and policy. They are keen on augmenting their expertise particularly in the areas of evidence-based policy analysis, interaction between urban design and mobility, as well as assessment of built environments. Aside from pursuing mainstream consulting, they are highly motivated to undertake research (both open-ended and sponsored) that addresses some fundamental concerns of cities across a wide spectrum of geographical contexts in India. The guest lecture will be held in person in MAR room 0.017 from 10:00 CEST onwards.  I would therefore request everyone to arrive before time to listen to the entire lecture.  The lecturers from Mysore, India, will join us online via Zoom.  The lecture is anticipated to end around 11:15, followed by a break, after which we will have final group presentations on the following topics:  Topic 1: Overview of module 2 –Transport trends in advanced industrial countries  Topic 2: Overview of Module 3- Transport trends from developing countries Topic 4: Comparative analysis between module 2 and module 3 I will request everyone to attend tomorrow's session for a fruitful discussion.  See you all tomorrow morning!  Best wishes, Megha

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Class Attendance and final semester presentation information

Messages.Author: Megha Tyagi
Messages.Content: Dear students,  As we head into the final weeks of the semester, I wanted to share some important information to ensure everyone gets the most out of this time. First, I want to express my concern regarding the absence of many students in the class in previous sessions. Since we only have three more sessions remaining in the semester, I want to see everyone present, especially with two upcoming guest lectures and the final concluding day. The first is tomorrow, and the second is next week. Their busy schedules mean their time is valuable, so let's take advantage of this unique opportunity by attending the entire sessions.  Second, please plan to be present from 10:00 to 13:00 for all the following three sessions (tommorow's session will end soon by 11:00/11:10) . If you have a legitimate reason to leave early, please let me know by email beforehand.  Third, based on the voting results, the final session will be held on Thursday, July 18th, from 10:00 to 13:00 Uhr. We'll be back in the IVP building, room SG04 402 (where we met on June 21st). I am re-sharing the location here again: https://maps.app.goo.gl/unh1zUuxa82Avz4T6.   Fourth, I am sharing the final list of topics and presentation dates for the final semester presentation here.   Fifth, two groups have yet to choose their end-term paper topics. Please finalize your selection as soon as possible. Additionally, for all groups, please share a draft with me for feedback before submitting the final paper on August 30th.  I'll share details about tomorrow's guest lecture in a separate announcement.  Best wishes, Megha Tyagi

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Reminder: Tomorow's Online Guest Lecture on Cambodia

Messages.Author: Megha Tyagi
Messages.Content: Dear students,  We will have an online guest lecture tomorrow by Mr Conrad Richarsdon, a smart city and sustainable mobility specialist. The online lecture will start from 10:05 to 11:05/ 11:10 CEST. Here is the Zoom link for the lecture:  Tyagi, Megha is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting on the TU Berlin zoom service. Topic: Transport Planning in International Context Time: 10:05 AM CEST Join Zoom Meeting https://tu-berlin.zoom.us/j/67492326507?pwd=SUtnYkMybk9PbkFNSTIyUndoYnVKdz09 Meeting ID: 674 9232 6507 Passcode: 644683 About the Guest Lecturer Conrad has a professional background in urban and transport planning, engineering, design, and governance across Asia, Africa, North America, the Middle East, and Europe. He is currently based in Cambodia and has been proactively working on socially inclusive, locally desired, and environmentally benign projects and technology solutions for the public and private sectors for many years. This is his LinkedIn profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/conradrichardson/  About the lecture He will present his work experience in Cambodia and other Southeast Asian countries. However, one of the highlights of this guest lecture will also include his professional career story about how he landed in the field of transportation, especially after pursuing an interesting dissertation for his master's thesis. So, this lecture will be interesting for students who will be especially heading to start their dissertation in the coming semester(s).  Please feel free to ask questions, especially for groups covering Asian cities, in their final presentation.   See you all tomorrow online!  Best wishes, Megah
